entry.title: [SAA] Extending Storage Access API to omit unpartitioned cookies
entry.content:
The current Storage Access API requires that unpartitioned cookie access

is granted if any unpartitioned storage access is needed. This forces

unpartitioned cookies to be included in network requests which may not

need them, having impacts on network performance and security. Before

the extension ships, we have a chance to fix this behavior without a

compatibility break.



Design Doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/19qCGb4qwOcGiNrQM3ptWvRmB4JtpaTFgFVlWLXNOQ6c/edit



Explainer:

https://arichiv.github.io/saa-non-cookie-storage/omit-unpartitioned-cookies.html



Bug: 1484966

Change-Id: Id0d29df0de173667b70d14761acdb95c543fea0f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5228597

entry.title: Fixing crash in BackForwardMenuModel due to navigation when menu is open
entry.content:
There have been numerous crashes in BackForwardMenuModel. These all seem

to have the same root cause. There are cases where navigation could

happen when the menu is open and this causes the index to be out of sync

and this could trigger CHECK or DCHECK failures in code. The fix

attempts to observe navigation on the active web content when the menu

is open and notifies the delegate about the menu changes which results

in keeping things in sync.



Bug: 1516574, 1351386

Change-Id: I45d020d71a9127e162988c00f59c2493f15cb4c8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5221026

entry.title: [A11y] Do not rely on state propagation for aria-hidden changes
entry.content:
In CL:5169706, the implementation for aria-hidden changes was changed

to use a new propagation mechanism (OnInheritedCachedValuesChanged()) that can propagate cached states downward in a subtree.



However, aria-hidden changes can also result in changes to the validity

of aria-owns (as aria-hidden objects

do not support aria-owns), and aria-owns can affect parts of the tree

that are not strictly descendants.



The previous implementation addressed this

better, by simply wiping out the subtree with the aria-hidden change.



Fixed: 1518333

Change-Id: If88bff798f7098b1847a9277d0e92a00eddaf27a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5232814

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252312}

entry.title: [CSC] Fix the killswitch
entry.content:
Use a base::Feature killswitch that is distinct from the one

auto-generated to go with the OT token. Use the killswitch

to gracefully reject Captured Surface Control API calls

coming from an OT-enabled site if the killswitch is engaged.



Prior to this change, OT users who did not manually enable

the CapturedSurfaceControl base::Feature ran into

a render process crash (through a BadMessage).

entry.title: [PM] Make WebContentsProxy a simple WeakPtr<WebContents> wrapper
entry.content:
This removes some complexity from PerformanceManagerTabHelper that's

no longer needed.



* Remove ResourceCoordinatorSignalObserver::GetContentsForDispatch,

which has no callers.

* Remove WebContentsProxy::LastNavigationId and

WebContentsProxy::LastNewDocNavigationId, which have no callers

except GetContentsForDispatch.

* Since PerformanceManagerTabHelper no longer needs to implement

LastNavigationId and LastNewDocNavigationId, it no longer needs to

be a WebContentsProxyImpl and pass WebContentsProxy a WeakPtr to

itself. Instead it can pass WebContentsProxy a WeakPtr to the

WebContents.



Bug: 1134162

entry.title: Treat layers with duplicated IDs as invalid.
entry.content:
We do not expect duplicated IDs from the server. However, layer IDs being unique is a useful assumption for limited entropy randomization.



This CL provides an implementation that will discard any layer from the seed if its ID is not unique, and emit an enum histogram. For example, a seed may have {layer_id:101, layer_id:101, layer_id:999}. With this CL, only the layer with ID 999 will be valid. This means any study referencing the layers with ID 101 is not going to be assigned (see study_filtering.cc, ShouldAddStudy()).



Bug: b/319690282

Change-Id: I5f64ca68b8b8df7ce47248758db45d4cfc8007f9

entry.title: Remove the DCHECK for directly composited image tiling size and layer bounds
entry.content:
Floating point error may cause the difference between scaled tiling

size and layer bounds to be slightly larger than the epsion (==1).

We could increase the epsilon to tolerate errors, but I'm changing

how we calculate tiling rect, which will make the check invalid.



Bug: 1517714, 1515657

entry.title: viz: Accumulate embedder transform when calculating overlay damage index
entry.content:
SurfaceAggregator has a check to not assign an overlay damage index to a

quad if it is smaller than the surface damage (in which case we cannot

confidently say that the damage is attributable to the quad). This

check transforms the quad rect to the closest compositor frame root and

compares it with a surface damage rect. If the closest compositor frame

root is not the overall root, these rects may end up in different

coordinate spaces.



This CL appends the transform to the true root for the quad rect so the

comparison is done in root space. This is not an issue currently since

we don't observe the overlay damage index for quads in non-root passes,

but will be needed for partially delegated compositing on Windows.



Bug: 1132392

Change-Id: Idb697c7ef024029d92c048f7b7b77c6809e151d7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5187468

entry.title: Revert "Move filling timestamp from FillingContext to FormStructure"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a6c255be62c3c443f3f93f2f689e48bfe902f0a9.



Reason for revert: possible culprit of build failures crbug.com/1521832



Original change's description:

> Move filling timestamp from FillingContext to FormStructure

>

> We are targeting renaming FillingContext to RefillContext, as it is

> mainly used for refills and not every "filling" related information is

> stored in it.

>

> One thing that is used outside of refills is the filling time. This CL

> moves it out of the struct and into FormStructure.

>

> This CL also modifies the nature of the variable from `original`

> filling time to `last` filling time, as this would be more appropriate

> with its usage.

>

> The CL also records it for field by field filling, which initially did

> not set it.

entry.title: WebUI: Enforce querySelector<Type>() pattern via ESLint, part 2.
entry.content:
A common misuse of querySelector/querySelectorAll is to use a type cast,

like

this.shadowRoot.querySelector(...) as Type



instead of leveraging the type parameter, like

this.shadowRoot.querySelector(...)



In this part fixing several violations in ash/webui/ code. The goal is

to enable ESLint no-restricted-syntax checks to catch these by default

in upcoming CLs.

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Add interstitial histograms for async checks
entry.content:
We'd like to know how long the user sees the page before seeing the

warning as well as whether it affects the warning bypass rate.



This CL includes the following changes to achieve it:

* Log when the navigation is committed in AsyncCheckTracker.

* Add an optional blocked_page_shown_timestamp field in

MetricsHelper::ReportDetails and log the histograms based on the

value.

* Inject blocked_page_shown_timestamp when Safe Browsing blocking

page is created. If it is created in a navigation throttle, it

is set to nullopt because the page is never shown. Otherwise, we

will get the timestamp from AsyncCheckTracker (see the change in

BaseUIManager::DisplayBlockingPage).

* Log the delay histogram when an interstitial is shown in

SecurityInterstitialTabHelper::DidFinishNavigation.



Side note: It is hard to get the exact time when the warning is

displayed on user's screen, so we use the time when

DidFinishNavigation is called as a "proxy" for when the warning is

displayed. We only need the relative "delay" between the page and the

interstitial, so this approach should work.



Histograms added:

interstitial.{SecurityInterstitialSBType}decision{RepeatVisit}{IsPostCommitInterstitialSuffix}

(e.g. interstitial.phishing.decision.after_page_shown)

interstitial.{SecurityInterstitialSBType}interaction{IsPostCommitInterstitialSuffix}

(e.g. interstitial.phishing.interaction.after_page_shown)

interstitial.{SecurityInterstitialSBType}show_delay{SecurityInterstitialSBWithSourceType}

(e.g. interstitial.phishing.show_delay.from_real_time_check)



Bug: 1501194

Change-Id: Ib026bfbaccb1559ac740a691cf1e0694cc81a530

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5231021

entry.title: Move experimental WebGPU features behind a new blink runtime feature
entry.content:
This CL gates the following WebGPU experimental features from

WebGPUDeveloperFeatures to new WebGPUExperimentalFeatures blink runtime

feature to assess those are meant to land in the WebGPU spec and not

for development purposes:

- GPUAdapter.isCompatibilityMode

- GPUCommandEncoder.writeTimestamp()

- GPUComputePipelineDescriptor.requiresFullSubgroups

- GPURequestAdapterOptions.compatibilityMode

- GPUSupportedLimits.minSubgroupSize

- GPUSupportedLimits.maxSubgroupSize

- GPUTextureDescriptor.textureBindingViewDimension

entry.title: trusted_vault: record URL fetch response statuses per security domain
entry.content:
Replace the `Sync.TrustedVaultURLFetchResponse{Reason}` metric with

`TrustedVault.SecurityDomainServiceURLFetchResponse{Reason}{SecurityDomainId}`.



The new metric breaks requests to security domain service up by the

domain affected by the request. It also adds a new reason variant

`DownloadAuthenticationFactorsRegistrationState` for requests added in

CL:5166109.



Also add a second metric for URL requests to recovery key store (Vault

service). We shouldn't group these into the same metrics because (a)

it's a different service, and (b) the requests are not tied to a

particular security domain, so the pattern doesn't fit.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Histograms Sync.TrustedVaultURLFetchResponse{Reason} were replaced by TrustedVault.SecurityDomainServiceURLFetchResponse{Reason}{SecurityDomainId}"



Bug: 1223853,1495928

entry.title: Sort DNS results after each transaction
entry.content:
Only done if a new kUseHostResolverCache experiment is enabled. If

using the new cache, which separately caches results for each DNS

transaction, need to sort results for each transaction instead of only

sorting all results together after the completion of all transactions.



When doing the transaction-separate sort, no sort is done on the final

merged results. This is a slight behavior change as it ends up meaning

IPv4 and IPv6 results are separately sorted and all IPv6 always placed

before all IPv4 in the final results, but this shouldn't have any real

results in practice since the connection code is now separating them

and ignoring the inter-family order anyway.



Another minor change is that the old merged sort only did any sorting

when results contained at least one IPv6 address, but the transaction-

separate sort is always done as long as the transaction has at least

one result. This is mostly a simplification, but we also can no longer

use IPv6 presence to decide on whether or not to sort IPv4 because we

don't necessarily know if we'll have AAAA results when A results are

ready.



Also, turned out that we didn't have any HostResolver tests verifying

that AddressSorter was used at all, so a big portion of this CL ended up

being adding those tests for both with and without the new experiment

enabled.



Bug: 1448654

Change-Id: Ifaffa78b6492eb406d20230ac2ee5e3d66a72233

entry.title: [base] Prepare "current default task runner" for RunOrPostTask support.
entry.content:
In preparation for a CL that will make

(Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault() return the

correct task runner inside RunOrPostTask, this CL allows:



- Setting the current default SingleThreadTaskRunner to null in a scope

that already has a current default (this will be used to set the

current default SingleThreadTaskRunner to null when running a task

synchronously).

- Setting the current default SequencedTaskRunner to a new value in

a scope that already has a current default (this will be used to

set the current default SequencedTaskRunner to the one on which

RunOrPostTask was called when running a task synchronously).

entry.title: Add support for allowing elements with display:contents to be focused.
entry.content:
Chromestatus: https://chromestatus.com/feature/6237396851228672



This lands support for allowing elements with display:contents to be

focused, behind a feature flag that is created with status:experimental.



This is as concluded (though without a group resolution) in

https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/2632 and as discussed a bit

in https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/1837 and proposed in

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9425 . Note that this diverges from

Gecko (see https://bugzil.la/1553549, https://bugzil.la/1791648, and

https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/772) and WebKit

(see https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=255149 and

https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/164).



This makes the element focusable when it has a tabindex. Note

that this does not match Gecko and WebKit, which also require that its

'display' value is changed (away from 'contents') to make it focusable.



Note that the element is still not tabbable in Chrome; this is

https://crbug.com/1428419. This also does not match Gecko and WebKit,

where it is tabbable whenever it is focusable. The added test

slot-element-tabbable.tentative.html fails both tests as a result, but

is added anyway. (Gecko and WebKit pass the display: block test but

fail the default style (display: contents) test.)



The added tests display-contents-focusable-001.html and

slot-element-focusable.tentative.html are partly fixed by this change,

but the style part is still broken due to https://crbug.com/1428420.



Bug: 1366037

Bug: 1428419, 1428420

Change-Id: I46a8ad3b6442ce07f440c8f6a07210bac305600e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3910374

Reviewed-by: Mason Freed

Commit-Queue: David Baron

entry.title: Organize OpenXR "Extension Handlers"
entry.content:
The "Android" specific extensions are generally living in the

openxr/android folder, but as more "Msft" specific extension files are

being written, the directory is getting a little cluttered. This change

organizes "Extension Handlers" into a folder matching the name of the

extension that they implement. Since Android files were already doing

this, this just moves "MSFT" files into a "msft" folder, and the one

"meta" extension into an "fb" folder (since that's what in the

extension name). Classes are also named to match their new folder

extension and with appropriate casing for Chromium (e.g. Msft vs MSFT).



This was done in a ~mostly automated process (scene files were specified

one-by-one):



PS#1:

cd device/vr/openxr

mkdir msft

git mv *_msft* msft/

git mv msft/_msft.(ext)

git mv openxr_hand_tracker_meta.(h|cc) fb/openxr_hand_tracker_fb.(h|cc)

tools/git/mass-rename.py



PS#2:

s/OpenXrHandTrackerMeta/OpenXrHandTrackerFb



In VSCode (exact regex strings used):

Find: OpenXrScene(|Bounds|Object|Observer|Plane)( |::|\(|>|&|\*|,|;)

Replace: OpenXrScene$1MSFT$2



PS #3:

git cl format



Find:OpenXr(\w*)MSFT (Match Case)

Replace: OpenXr$1Msft



Clang formatting errors were discovered upon upload, and so manual clang

formatting was triggered from within vscode for openxr_scene_msft.cc and

openxr_scene_understanding_manager_msft.cc



Note that the MSFT rename had two phases because of a late decision to

convert MSFT to Msft.

entry.title: Fix recording of boolean for UKM Cookies_FirstPartyPartitionedInCrossSiteContext
entry.content:
Previously the code would only record a true value for the boolean CookiePresent value associated with the UKM because the method that makes the call to record would return without recording if the cookie was first party partitioned and had no cross-site ancestor.



This CL addresses that bug by no longer returning when a cookie is no first party partitioned and had no cross-site ancestor. Instead saving the results of that calculation as a boolean to be used for setting the CookiePresent value for the UKM.

entry.title: [EditContext] Allow backwards selection
entry.content:
Per resolution of https://github.com/w3c/edit-context/issues/81,

EditContext should allow the author to set a backwards selection.



In addition to removing the restriction in updateSelection(),

various parts of EditContext need to be updated to handle a backwards

selection. In most cases this consists using helper functions that

ensure the forward version of the selection range is used.



Test cases are added, including for forward-selection scenarios

that were missing.



Some backspace/delete tests were removed from

edit-context-dom-mutation.html since edit-context-input-tentative.html

already has similar tests.

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Cancel pending jobs on sync state change
entry.content:
For jobs that are scheduled as a chain, allowing them to continue

after sync turns off could result in calls being made to the local

storage when they were originally intended for the account storage.



This is currently not an issue, because the java layer replies

with an error when the local storage is invoked. However, that error

needs to be removed, since local storage support is being added soon.



The same goes for posted delayed tasks like retries, but those will

be handled in a separate CL.

entry.title: WebUI: Enforce querySelector<Type>() pattern via ESLint, part 3.
entry.content:
A common misuse of querySelector/querySelectorAll is to use a type cast,

like

this.shadowRoot.querySelector(...) as Type



instead of leveraging the type parameter, like

this.shadowRoot.querySelector(...)



In this part fixing several violations in

- components/

- c/b/r/chromeos/

- c/b/r/ash/settings/

- c/test/data/webui/settings/chromeos/



The goal is to enable ESLint no-restricted-syntax checks to catch these

by default in upcoming CLs.

entry.title: Revert "[Autofill] Simplify ContentAutofillDriver initialization"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3b90869541da848d1791a4ca8b44bc0fd4af8347.



Reason for revert: reverted CL might have caused build failures crbug.com/1521832



Original change's description:

> [Autofill] Simplify ContentAutofillDriver initialization

>

> The DriverInitHooks have two jobs:

> (1) create a {Browser,Android}AutofillManager;

> (2) call some setters on AutofillAgent.

>

> Since the introduction of ContentAutofillClient, the DriverInitHook

> can be conveniently turned into a member function of the client.

>

> This CL introduces *two* new methods in CAC:

> (1) CreateManager(), to be called by CAD's constructor.

> (2) InitAgent(), to be called by the CAD factory.

>

> The point in time they're called is important:

> - CreateManager() is called before OnContentAutofillDriverCreated(),

> which is necessary for TestAutofillManagerInjector;

> - InitAgent() is called after OnContentAutofillDriverCreated(),

> which avoids trouble with double binding mojo remotes when

> TestAutofillDriverInjector creates a new driver.

>

> Alternatives I considered are:

> - Calling CreateManager() from the factory. This would avoid the

> potential problem of the manager calling into the driver during

> the driver's construction. Rejected because this requires

> CAD::set_autofill_manager(), and since driver and manager

> have to point to each other, there will always be some kind of

> chicken-egg problem.

> - Calling InitAgent() from CAD's constructor. Rejected because

> - tests that mock an AutofillAgent would attempt to bind *two*

> remotes, which isn't allowed;

> - unbinding and rebinding remotes

> - makes writing tests harder;

> - seems not to work for the renderer -> browser remote.

> - Calling CreateManager() and InitAgent() or only InitAgent() from

> a virtual CAD::Init() function, which is be called by the CAD

> factory. Tests would override Init() and only call CreateDriver(),

> not InitAgent(). Rejected because that'd make writing tests harder.

>

> The DriverInitHook model worked similarly, but it probably worked

> out of luck: the DriverInitHooks didn't actually call

> GetAutofillAgent() in most tests, which happened to avoid the

> double bind in all relevant tests.

>

> Bug: 1200511

> Change-Id: I339a8b0e7531a76395e5e50dba16f77e3385f56a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224630

> Reviewed-by: Jan Keitel

> Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252040}



Bug: 1200511

Change-Id: I4885522ac5e9a8d0f4f9475856907a22d796dd1d

entry.title: Use span instead of unsized pointer for SampleVector counts
entry.content:
The PersistentMemoryAllocator::Get() method currently allocates some

memory and returns a pointer to the front of it. Instead, return a

span. Since the span should know the actual type, template the Get()

method and have it CHECK that the returned memory will be aligned

appropriately.



Then SampleVector subclasses pass along the span up to

SampleVectorBase so that when it iterates over the counts, it can

do so knowing the bounds of the array and preventing any possibility

of going out of bounds.



The null pointer atomic is converted to an optional since it

null to encode whether the atomic had ever been set or not, but also

allows it to be set with an empty array.



R=caitlinfischer@google.com



Bug: 1490484

Change-Id: I79decf962a0a2d83cbaa5f7e24448bef477ec22c

entry.title: [ios] Fix ParcelTracking module vertical layout issue
entry.content:
Constraining the ParcelTracking's stackview top and bottom anchors to

its overall content view will constrain the content view to hug the

contents. This causes the title stackview to be the one that vertically

expand to fill the extra space, which leaves the parcel tracking

contents too far down.

entry.title: Don't create a new SQS if it is not needed.
entry.content:
The changes between this CL and the original reverted one is that

the new SharedQuadState is only created when the track's opacity is

going to be different from the thumb's opacity, avoiding redundant

creations of SharedQuadStates that caused render pass bugs (with

the appropriate flags enabled, you could see the track being

painted with the default blue).



I've added a win-asan run to the CL to ensure that it passes and

won't get reverted in the future.





Reland "Fix software rendering of Fluent overlay animation"



This is a reland of commit 922af472cbdd0faa8c13ebf7f55dcfc73f2c81e8



Original change's description:

> Fix software rendering of Fluent overlay animation

>

> When hardware acceleration is disabled, the track's quad in Fluent

> Overlay scrollbar has the opacity of the layer instead of the value

> we set the for the quad's `vertex_opacity`.

> This causes a jank when mousing over the scrollbar since the track's

> opacity animation is skipped and it just appears at full opacity.

> This can be fixed by creating a new `SharedQuadState` for the track

> and setting the transitionary opacity in the state instead of the

> quad.

> Please find a more detailed explanation in #c1 in the linked bug.

> This CL also moves around some definitions of variables to be closer

> to where they are actually used.

>

> Bug: 1496407

> Change-Id: I841f6b8c8fddea935830cd508a40ae6b44c50d8f

entry.title: Remove the V1 cc metrics path
entry.content:
The last of the usage of V1 metrics in ChromeOS was removed:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5213406



This change removes all of the path usage to calculate V1 metrics.

Several signals are no longer needed by FrameSequenceTacker as we use

the AddSortedFrame path for V3. This also removes old debugging traces

that are no longer needed, with PipelineReporter being easier to follow.

This should address the OoM seen in crbug.com/1518417



FrameSequenceTackerTest was overhauled to reflect the new signalling

and AddSortedFrame post processing.



This also removes V1 Graphics.Smoothness.*Stale as the final Finch

using it launched.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Graphics.Smoothness.MaxStale]=finches complete, no longer needed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Graphics.Smoothness.Stale]=finches complete, no longer needed

entry.title: [wpt] Fix misnamed tests that get HTTP 404
entry.content:
`x.any.window.js` isn't a valid suffix [0] because it generates URLs

`x.window.any.html` and `x.window.any.worker.html`. This confuses

wptserve's extension substitution [1], which look for a nonexistent

file `x.window.any.js` (note the reversed order of the `.any` and

`.window` flags).



According to the PR [2] that introduced these tests, these should just

be plain `.window.js` tests.



`wpt lint` should ban such invalid flags in a follow-up PR upstream.



[0]: https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/testharness.html

[1]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/e7b773cb/tools/serve/serve.py#L320

[2]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/29765#discussion_r697208154



Bug: 1517496, 1499775

entry.title: Unify the conditions to calls MakeCurrent() in SwapBuffers()
entry.content:
Since [1], lacros was unconditionally skipping calling MakeCurrent()

from SkiaOutputSurfaceImpl::SwapBuffers().

The idea was to gradually achieve the same for other platforms,

or only call it when needed.



After [2], the unification of the existing conditions is

now possible: lacros will continue not to call MakeCurrent, and other

platforms will call it when gpu fences per-plane is not supported,

or when

OutputSurface::Capabilities::renderer_allocates_images is false,

to support cases where SkiaOutputDeviceGL is used.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/5041072

[2] https://crrev.com/c/5205691



BUG=1520886, 1494032

R=petermcneeley@chromium.org



Change-Id: I27edf3551341435c4c024e685283bdba3e259d16

entry.title: [iOS] Tap to dismiss snackbars in Reading List tests
entry.content:
Snackbar with actions are not auto-dismissed anymore by default with

a recent change in material components. This cased some Reading List

EGTests to fail since the snackbars remained on the screen.



(See https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/g/material-ios-discuss/c/2vGQ_7yBkGY)



This CL adds a tap on those snackbars to ensure that they are always dismissed, and re-enables the disabled tests.

entry.title: [ios-blink] Remove stream tracking from AudioManagerIOS
entry.content:
Currently, stream tracking variables serve no meaningful purpose. They

were merely copied from the macOS implementation, where they were

utilized to determine buffer size. However, for the minimal iOS

implementation, such a requirement does not exist. Therefore, this

change removes stream tracking from AudioManagerIOS.

entry.title: [GCM] Prevent deadlock after network change during handshake
entry.content:
This CL covers a corner case which shouldn't normally happen in

practice: if there is an ongoing handshake when a network change is

happening with an error during connection (which is quite unlikely),

there won't be next connection attempt without another network change

event. This CL fixes this case.

entry.title: printing: Fix rotation for landscape-sized pages
entry.content:
There is a check to make sure that print media always has a larger

height than width, ensuring the media is in portrait. This is done by

swapping the width and height of the media and also transposing the

printable area rectangle. This works fine when the top/bottom margins

are the same and when the left/right margins are the same. However,

when the margins are not the same, a simple transpose does not work.



Update this logic to swap the printable area (by rotating 90 degrees

clockwise) when converting a landscape-sized paper to media.



Bug: b:297121018

entry.title: Delete payment instrument tables and add masked bank account table
entry.content:
Since the payment_instrument_supported_rails table is deleted, we are no

longer storing information about what rails are supported for the masked

bank account in the autofill table. For now, this information is hardcoded

in the BankAccount data model and when we have use cases that require

supporting multiple rails, we'd reintroduce the

payment_instrument_supported_rails table.



Note: Operations for the masked_bank_accounts_metadata will be added

in a follow-up change.
